definition[1]: a substitute in sports such as football
definition[3]: part of your wages that you receive earlier than usual because you need money
definition[4]: a long bread roll, split open and filled with meat, cheese etc
definition[7]: to act as a substitute for someone
example[0]: Roy’s subbing for Chris in tonight’s game.
definition[8]: to give someone part of their wages earlier than usual or lend them money
example[1]: I subbed Fenella a tenner to get a decent bunch of flowers.
definition[10]: under or below a particular level or thing
definition[11]: less important or powerful than someone or something, or of lower rank than someone
definition[13]: not as good as other people or things
example[10]: Can you sub me £20 until pay day?
